meanings.definition: To strip or deprive of something
meanings.sent1: She divests her room of unnecessary clutter before moving.
meanings.sent2: The company divests itself of unprofitable assets to stay afloat.
meanings.sent3: He divests his sandwich of all the pickles, much to his friend's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The sunset divests the sky of its vibrant colors, leaving behind a serene darkness.
meanings.sent5: The magician divests the hat of a rabbit, astonishing the audience.

meanings.definition: To rid or free oneself of something
meanings.sent1: He divests himself of all worries when he goes for a walk in the park.
meanings.sent2: She divests herself of old habits to embrace a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The cat divests itself of the annoying bell collar by cleverly slipping out of it.
meanings.sent4: The hero divests himself of the heavy armor, feeling liberated and agile.
meanings.sent5: The tree divests itself of its leaves in the fall, preparing for winter.
